Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Godballz> If the attacker cashes out, what does he care of the value of the coin? He didn't to begin with.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Gloryman> It seems to me that pow has more incentives to drive the coin forward. 1. Big investors in the coin will want there to be lots of powerful miners to protect their investment and transactions. 2. Big miners will want to put work into securing the network in order to protect their investment on hardware and the currency they want to sell. 3. New casual users of the coin will use a coin with lots of people incentives to protect it. But yeah, if their is not enough incentives from time to time, then they can suffer attacks. But obviously I'm a noob in this and I'm interested in seeing how this pos works.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> @rptr that means you likely need to rescan. you can do that by starting the daemon again, either by restarting Agama or the CLI, and when you do, if Agama, select "Activate coin" the long way and choose "daemon param: rescan" as a drop down option on native

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <OhGodAGuardian> @jl777c The purpose of an attack is to gain profit - most often by stealing from an exchange via a double spend. They spend to the first exchange, then mine enough to cause a reorg in which they omit this transaction, and as such may now spend it again to another exchange. It's not only really, really likely to completely shatter trust in a coin - even if people hold it up, it's clear that the coin is not safe. The effect is pretty much catastrophic on success.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <OhGodAGuardian> @miketout Also, you may know this already, but I just wanna make sure you *really* get what I meant about carry-less multiply. It's basically an instruction to accelerate performing operations inside a finite field of degree 2. To give you some sort of idea... a partially-optimized multiplication inside the finite field 2^4 which I needed, I implemented in a total of 26 gates.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Cruz> So I'm guessing that now, we aren't going Cryptopia lol.. Honestly, why not KuCoin?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <Cruz> It's not about price, at all.
I think, being around for 6 to 7 months, we've developed a very strong & very talented community. 
At some point though, it would benefit the project, bc of the exposure. We would be on a major exchange & also be on CMC. I think these are two things that most projects do. 
This only my personal opinion. And I feel comfortable posting it here and seeing what others say, bc there are some very knowledgeable people in this discord.
